Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau
Additional Scope Comments: Cut off in five-year blocks at the end of the calendar year; transfer email records 15 years after the cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: TTB will apply the Capstone approach to email records management (GRS 6.1) retrospectively to all available legacy email.  TTB has some permanent email from accounts that pre-date 2003 that were active at the time of re-organization, which originated with TTB's predecessor organization within the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF).  Email from accounts inactive at the time of re-organization were not transferred to TTB.  ATF is responsible for managing these records.  Also, pre-dated 2003 printed email records are maintained in respective industry/case file disposed as per record schedule.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of the Army  US Army Africa
Additional Scope Comments: Army Corps of Engineers, RG 77, Office of the Surgeon General RG 112, Army Staff RG 319,  Army Secretariat RG 335, Army Special Operations Command  RG 338, Army Space & Missile Defense Command RG 338,  Army Surface Deployment & Distribution Command RG 338, US Army South RG 338, US Army North/5th Army RG 338, US Army Central RG 338, Army Materiel Command RG 544, US Army Europe RG 549, US Army Pacific RG 550, Army Training & Doctrine Command RG 553, Army Forces Command RG 555.Other emails will be managed using standard Records Management practices based on content of the email.  They will be placed into electronic folders in the Army Records Information Management System (ARIMS).  Army is also pursuing other automated records management solutions with DOD and other DOD Components for use in automated processing of all electronic records.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.

Cutoff Instructions: Item 10 - Cut off at end of appointmentItem 11 and 12 - Cut off at the end of calendar year.  Delete when 10 years old, but longer retention is authorized if required for business use.
Transfer Instructions: Item 10 - Transfer 10 years after cutoff  (Chairman and Commissioners serve 5 year appointments; equaling 15 year transfer)
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010.
